org.jpws.data

Class PwsFileSocket.BackupManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.data.PwsFileSocket.BackupManager
  • Enclosing class:
    PwsFileSocket

    public static class PwsFileSocket.BackupManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Organises automatic backups for PwsFiles in PwsFileSocket objects. May also be used to gain information on stored auto-backup files of a database.
    Since:
    0-5-0, 0-6-0 modified status and parameters for public use (private before)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BackupManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void eraseFiles()
      Erases all listed backup files (including their persistent states).
      java.util.List<org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile> getBackupList()
      Returns a list of ContextFile objects representing the actually stored auto-backup copies of the enclosing object's database file.
      org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile getTopBackup()
      Returns the youngest backup file from this manager's domain or null if no backup is available.
      boolean performBackup(PwsFileSocket socket)
      Creates a backup copy of the parameter socket's database file according to the regulations set up by the user.
      void refresh(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f)
      Discards any previous content and gathers new information about the stored auto-backup copies of the parameter database file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackupManager

        public BackupManager()

    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        public void refresh(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile f)
        Discards any previous content and gathers new information about the stored auto-backup copies of the parameter database file.

      • performBackup

        public boolean performBackup(PwsFileSocket socket)
        Creates a backup copy of the parameter socket's database file according to the regulations set up by the user. This includes maintaining the correct size of the total backup copies for this database.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if a copy has been created

      • eraseFiles

        public void eraseFiles()
        Erases all listed backup files (including their persistent states).

      • getBackupList

        public java.util.List<org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile> getBackupList()
        Returns a list of ContextFile objects representing the actually stored auto-backup copies of the enclosing object's database file. (The list is a shallow clone of the internal list.)
        Returns:
        List of ContextFile sorted descending on the file modification times

      • getTopBackup

        public org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile getTopBackup()
        Returns the youngest backup file from this manager's domain or null if no backup is available.
